oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mathematical model to simulate the temperature and composition distribution inside the flux layer of a continuous casting mould
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NEELAKANTAN, VN
SRIDHAR, S
MILLS, KC
SICHEN, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: powder
flux layer
continuous casting
model
volatile
carbon burning
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A model is presented to predict the mass transport and heat transfer in a continuous casting mould flux bed. Physically consistent micromodels for carbon burning, evaporation of volatiles and thermophysical properties in the mould flux layer have been combined with a one-dimensional finite-difference model of the continuous casting mould flux bed. The sensitivity of the model to bed height, flux consumption rate, carbon burning and powder particle size is investigated for a mould flux composition corresponding to an industrial casting powder.
